text: [Applause]
[Music]
hello I'm Daisy a cloud support engineer
here at the AWS office in Sydney I'm
going to show you how you can find out
if your Amazon elastic compute Cloud
Amazon easy to reserved instances are
being used and whether you're receiving
a billing discount let's get
started after you sign in to the AWS m
Management console navigate to the
Amazon ec2 console in the navigation
pane choose instances as you can see I
have three running instances and all of
them are the T3 small instance
type next in the navigation pane choose
reserved instances to make sure you have
active reserved instances the scope
column tells you whether the scope of
the reserve instance is for an AWS
region or a specific availability Zone
and helps you determine the instances
that benefit from the billing discount
as you can see I have a region specific
scope if you purchase a reserved
instance and you already have a running
on demand instance that matches the
specifications of the reserved instance
then the billing discount is applied
immediately and automatically to review
the billing discount I'll navigate to
the billing and cost Management console
to view my billing
summary in the navigation pane I'll
choose
bills next I'll scroll down to view
charges for AWS services and then expand
the elastic compute Cloud section and
the region to view the billing
information about my reserved
instances you can review your RI type
and the billing RS that the billing
benefit was applied
to to download the report choose
download all to CSV
for regional reserved instances the
billing discount applies to any instance
within the same instance family
regardless of the size
purchased because I have three T3 small
instances running and one active
Regional reserved instance that's a T3
medium instance type the reserved
instance spilling discount is applied to
two out of the three T3 small instances
so now you know how to find out if your
Amazon ec2 reserved instances are being
used and whether you're receiving a
billing
discount thanks for watching in Happy
Cloud Computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Applause]
[Music]
